sub_title: IT Business Partner | Senior IT Project Manager
summary:
Successfully completed multiple cross functional projects and helped companies to reduce costs, be more efficient and lean with less FTEs, be compliant, modern and fast.

In short:
•	10+ years of extensive experience with project management and business analytics 
•	Broad portfolio of various integration, automation, migration and infrastructure projects
•	Diverse fields of practice including banking, finance, compliance, BPM, software and IT
•	Experienced in leading large diverse teams (onsite, offsite, vendors)
•	Proficient in Agile techniques, certified PSPO I and PSM I
•	Certified Lean Green Belt
•	Software development, implementation and integration leading
•	DataDriven product management incl. intelligence (semantic, etc.) analysis 
•	Experienced in RPA (UiPath) and business process improvements
•	Proficient in UX/UI design, incl. prototyping and CJM developing
•	Mobile Web, mobile applications development
•	SaaS and eCommerce knowledge
•	Both good as a team or individual player

Master degrees in Computer Science and Management

awards.title: Best Project in nomination "Information systems development"​
awards.description:
Every year Softline Group Russia holds a best projects competition. Projects are estimated according to their scale, revenue and technological solutions in a several categories, so the categories also compete with each other.

In 2013 our project "Optimization of the public informational portal VTB24 Bank" became the Best Project in category "Information systems development"​ with the 3d summary indicator within the whole Softline Group Russia.

awards.title: The best youth entrepreneurial project among university students of Moscow
awards.description: The "Crowdsourcing community RUTEST» project had the 3rd place in the competition "The best youth entrepreneurial project among university students of Moscow".

projects.title: Staff activities monitoring system
projects.description:
A large B2B system that helps employees of the bank to improve their KPIs (Key Performance Indicators) and simplify their ordinary live. The system monitors activity of employees and helps managers to keep fingers on the pulse of their departments.

Some system modules:
- staff testing and certificating;
- online monitors (tasks processing, operating systems downtime, various analytical monitors, etc.)
- "smart" task manager
- social add-ins

A pilot version for 240 000 people was lunched in early 2016 and it is expecting to increase the total amount of users to 400 000 of users next year.

In about a 1 year terms we created a system with:
- web application for desktops
- web application for mobile devises
- 2 mobile apps, first for iOS and then for Android devices.

System is based on Java and Oracle DB. It has a deep integration with several SAP systems, like SAP BusinessObjects Business Intelligence (BI) platform and SAP HR. Mobile application first worked under SAP Afaria, but than it was changed it to IBM WorkLight platform.

contributors.headline: IT Business Partner | Senior IT Project Manager

projects.title: Mobile web application 2.0 of the public portal of VTB24 Bank
projects.description:
A new Mobile web application (2.0) for the 3d largest Russian bank VTB24.

This mobile web app 2.0 is completely independent from the main public portal, so it will be available even if there would be some problems with the main portal. However, it is also possible to add content to the both versions simultaneously through the "one window" module (SharePoint 2010 custom extension on the main public portal of VTB24 Bank).

Mobile web app 2.0 is based on ASP.NET MVC.

Improved UX and a stable worked code made this mobile web app popular among the user, 
thereby increased marketing indexes and bank product's sales.

Status: still working.

contributors.headline: IT Business Partner | Senior IT Project Manager

projects.title: Mobile web application of the public portal of VTB24 Bank
projects.description:
Replaced by Mobile web-application 2.0 (which details are above).

The 1st mobile web app was "the fast made but worked well" decision that customer needed at that time.

The main goal of that time for VTB24 was to make a good and useable public portal for the desktop users. There was no mobile web app but only an adoptive public portal based on SharePoint 10 - one for all devices. But it didn't work properly on any of them.

We were asked to make some product that won't costs a lot, would be fast in implementation and  would be a good interim decision that can bridge the gap between mobile devices users and the Bank.

We made a small mobile web app that used a content from the main portal, but represent it a mobile-friendly way. It had some limitations, for example when there were a outage on main portal mob web app also stopped working. This and other problems were eliminated in Mobile web-application 2.0.

contributors.headline: IT Business Partner | Senior IT Project Manager

projects.title: Optimization of the public informational portal VTB24 Bank
projects.description:
This is a previous version of the existing portal vtb24.ru, it was in use since 2013 till summer 2016.

Our goal was to rebuild the whole existed portal so it could provide:
- Increase of conversion
- Better design and usability (UI and UX processing)
- Easier access to banking products (for example by reducing clicks required to get to the product request)
- Better banking services
- Increase of product sales
- Increase of marketing indicators
- Scalability enhancement (both horizontal and vertical)
- Strictly regulated and simplified interface of the Control Panel (primary for the content managers)

As a Product Owner in my team and a Technical Consultant for the business user i was deeply involved both in business and technical parts.

A full redesign of the portal were made, including changing it's structure and design (including UX paths). A leftover code review was also provided.

We implemented different methods to understand our user and gather user data. We made experimentations on focus group, used A/B testing and usability tests. I made decidions based on these researches results.

Within the portal redesign were made:
- The main page and Personal banking domain of the portal
- Commercial banking domain
- Privilege and Private banking
- Loans with all back- and frontend stuff including tariff calculators:
-- Personal Loans
-- Mortgage
-- Auto loans
- Credit Cards
- Debit Cards
- Savings including tariff calculators
- Bank's coins - still in use
- Discount programs - still
- Promotions and special offers - still in use
- Interactive maps - still in use
- Control panel (internal part of the portal)
And lots of smaller things on the portal and for internal use.

After project were completed and new statistic were gathered it was revealed that user influx and banking products sales were increased. Surveys also showed the increase of users satisfaction from the use of new services and design. So the goals of the project have been achieved successfully.

contributors.headline: IT Business Partner | Senior IT Project Manager

projects.title: Rosatom Career Center public portal and HR system
projects.description:
The portal rosatom-career.ru is a Rosatom Career Center public portal for young nuclear industry specialist. It contains the full information about Rosatom Career Center, its events and opened job positions in Rosatom and affiliated companies.

This portal also has a "private" part (primary HR system) that is only available from the intranet to the Rosatom affiliated companies. A private part is an analogue of http://www.indeed.nl/ for employers. But it is made only for atomic industry of Russia. This system also integrated with 14 consortium universities of Rosatom and has students profiles and all their "life history" so that companies could elicit the best ones.

contributors.headline: IT Business Partner | Senior IT Project Manager

projects.title: Young specialist guide "Career in the nuclear industry"​ №1(2011) and №2(2012)
projects.description:
Rosatom Career Center has launched a new "Young nuclear industry specialist career guide"​  project in 2011 year.

I was an executive editor and controlled directly the 1st and the 2nd editions of the Guide in 2011 and 2012 respectively. Each guide has a circulation of 4 000 copies.

Guide contains general information about Rosatom and  nuclear industry of the world. It also has a catalog of the main nuclear industry companies of Russia with information about the most demanded specialties in the industry and career opportunities that are available for students.

More information about Rosatom Career Center and Career Guide: http://rosatom-career.ru/center/about-the-career-center.

profile_positions.description:
A Business Process Expert at Exact is:
- Project Manager who leads multinational cross functional teams in different countries of the world
- Business process manager continuously improving business processes, unite experts and leading them to a unified goal
- IT Business Partner who leads steering committees, manages needs and expectations, maintains contacts and effectively communicates with stakeholders up to C-level
- Business Analyst who knows all the details of an industry domain
- DataDriven expert who combines the most modern technics and tools (e.g. RPA with UiPath) in order to contribute to company's goal to be the leader on the FinTech market
- QA who knows what has to work and how, and ensures it

Fields of practice:
- Corporate transformation and migration
- Corporate IT and infrastructure
- Risk and Internal Audit Department
- Shared Service Center (P2P, R2R, Facilities)
- Tax Group Of Exact
- Legal Affairs Department
profile_positions.title: Business Process Expert (Corporate IT)

profile_positions.description:
- Launched a pilot of a large B2B system for monitoring, analyzing and controlling activities of employees of the Bank
- Implemented a full cycle working process, built a team working space (tools, communication regulations, working schedules, etc.),
- Initiated adoption of Agile practices on a project, activally integrated business stakeholders (by moving away from a plain documentation to visual components like interactive prototypes) and end users in the daily process (UX research, gemba)
- Built a productive relationship among all the parties involved in the project (total team of a 45+ members of internal Bank employees from different departments and external suppliers, remote and on-site)
- Made a shift from SAP Afaria to IBM WorkLight platform in mobile application development. Architecture of the project consisted of 2
web applications (for desktops and for mobile devises) and 2 mobile apps (for iOS and Android devices)

Result:
- New B2B system (70,000 users in a pilot)
- 2 web applications for desktops and for mobile devises
- 2 mobile apps, first for iOS and then for Android devices
- Increased indicators of the employees' focus group
- Reached business goals and happy stakeholders
- Permission to open the 2d development phase for 240 000 users
profile_positions.title: Product Manager

profile_positions.description:
Lead IT analyst | Head of analyst group | Sharepoint consultant

Within almost 3 years in Softline:
- Worked on various consulting projects in financial and public sectors
- Started as an IT analyst in a team of 5 people, became a Lead Analyst with a team of about 45 members in less than a year period
- Wore different hats from a Sharepoint consultant for business customers (IT, product marketing, etc.) to a project manager
- Led a group of 5 analysts
- Made a several large B2C and B2B products for bank VTB24 (of the 3rd largest Russian bank at that time) as a solo IT consultants team (external development unit) to IT Department of the Bank

Main results:
- B2C product “New public portal of VTB24 Bank” including a new UX processing
- B2C products “Mobile web application of the public portal of VTB24 Bank” v.1 and 2
- Contributed to the transition from Waterfall to the Agile process within the bank IT Development Department
- Contributed to increasing of the sales and marketing performance of the bank
profile_positions.title: Lead IT Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Started as a hands-on business analyst in the Youth Career Center of Rosatom. Within 2 years became a team lead and reported to the Director of Special Projects of Rosatom (C-lvl, Board of the Minister of Atomic Industry of Russia).

Responsibilities and achievements:
- Comprehensive analysis of a business area of the Center resulted in a short and long term roadmap of a business development
- Functional design and development management of a Talent Pool Monitoring and Management System from scratch
- Business requirements grooming and analysis with a further design of small and medium IT products (landings, small portals for registration on events, workshops supporting environment adjustment, etc.) 
- Management of Center IT products (development, improvement, roadmap planning)
- Also: various graphic design, events support and management, writing publications and editing of the Center periodical magazine “Career in the Atomic Industry” (2011 and 2012, circulation of 4 000 copies each).
profile_positions.title: Lead Business Analyst

SmartVista is a comprehensive suite of solutions covering every aspect of electronic payments processing developing by BPC Group which provides banking services for more then 160 clients in more than 58 countries

Student project which goal was to create a product that could help QA and companies find and help each other with a temporary work. Some sort of Freelance for QAs. Won several prizes in competitions of urban scale, including in the "Personal Business"
